        <section>
          <title>
            <p>HOUSE GREYJOY</p>
          </title>
          <empty-line/>
          <image l:href="#i_012.png"/>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands, previously led a rebellion against the Iron Throne, put down by King Robert and Lord Eddard Stark. Though his son Theon, raised at Winterfell, was one of Robb Stark’s supporters and closest companions, Lord Balon did not join the northmen when they marched south into the riverlands. The Greyjoy sigil is a golden kraken upon a black field. Their words are <emphasis>We Do Not Sow.</emphasis></p>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>BALON GREYJOY, Lord of the Iron Islands, King of Salt and Rock, Son of the Sea Wind, Lord Reaper of Pyke, captain of the <emphasis>Great Kraken,</emphasis></p>
          <p>— his wife, LADY ALANNYS, of House Harlaw,</p>
          <p>— their children:</p>
          <p>—{RODRIK}, slain at Seagard during Greyjoy’s Rebellion,</p>
          <p>—{MARON}, slain at Pyke during Greyjoy’s Rebellion,</p>
          <p>— ASHA, captain of the <emphasis>Black Wind,</emphasis></p>
          <p>— THEON, a ward of Lord Eddard Stark at Winterfell,</p>
          <p>— his brothers:</p>
          <p>— EURON, called CROW’S EYE, captain of the <emphasis>Silence,</emphasis> an outlaw, pirate, and raider,</p>
          <p>— VICTARION, Lord Captain of the Iron Fleet, master of the <emphasis>Iron Victory,</emphasis></p>
          <p>— AERON, called DAMPHAIR, a priest of the Drowned God,</p>
          <p>— his household on Pyke:</p>
          <p>— DAGMER called CLEFTJAW, master-at-arms, captain of the <emphasis>Foamdrinker,</emphasis></p>
          <p>— MAESTER WENDAMYR, healer and counselor,</p>
          <p>— HELYA, keeper of the castle,</p>
          <p>— people of Lordsport:</p>
          <p>— SIGRIN, a shipwright,</p>
          <p>— his lords bannermen,</p>
          <p>— LORD BOTLEY, of Lordsport,</p>
          <p>— LORD WYNCH, of Iron Holt,</p>
          <p>— LORD HARLAW, of Harlaw,</p>
          <p>— STONEHOUSE, of Old Wyk,</p>
          <p>— DRUMM, of Old Wyk,</p>
          <p>— GOODBROTHER, of Old Wyk,</p>
          <p>— GOODBROTHER, of Great Wyk,</p>
          <p>— LORD MERLYN, of Great Wyk,</p>
          <p>— SPARR, of Great Wyk,</p>
          <p>— LORD BLACKTYDE, of Blacktyde,</p>
          <p>— LORD SALTCLIFFE, of Saltcliffe,</p>
          <p>— LORD SUNDERLY, of Saltcliffe.</p>
        </section>
        <section>
          <title>
            <p>HOUSE LANNISTER</p>
          </title>
          <empty-line/>
          <image l:href="#i_013.png"/>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>The Lannisters of Casterly Rock remain the principal support of King Joffrey’s claim to the Iron Throne. Their sigil is a golden lion upon a crimson field. The Lannister words are <emphasis>Hear Me Roar!</emphasis></p>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>TYWIN LANNISTER, Lord of Casterly Rock, Warden of the West, Shield of Lannisport, and Hand of the King, commanding the Lannister host at Harrenhal,</p>
          <p>— his wife, {LADY JOANNA}, a cousin, died in childbed,</p>
          <p>— their children:</p>
          <p>— SER JAIME, called the Kingslayer, Warden of the East and Lord Commander of the Kingsguard, a twin to Queen Cersei,</p>
          <p>— QUEEN CERSEI, widow of King Robert, twin to Jaime, Queen Regent and Protector of the Realm,</p>
          <p>— TYRION, called the IMP, a dwarf,</p>

          <p>— Ser Kevan’s wife, DORNA, of House Swyft,</p>

          <p>— Genna’s son, SER CLEOS FREY, taken captive at the Whispering Wood,</p>
          <p>— Genna’s son, TION FREY, a squire, taken captive at the Whispering Wood,</p>
          <p>—{SER TYGETT}, his second brother, died of a pox,</p>
          <p>— Tygett’s widow, DARLESSA, of House Marbrand,</p>
          <p>— Tygett’s son, TYREK, squire to the king,</p>
          <p>—{GERION}, his youngest brother, lost at sea,</p>
          <p>— Gerion’s bastard daughter, JOY, eleven,</p>

          <p>— Ser Stafford’s daughters, CERENNA and MYRIELLE,</p>

          <p>— SER ADDAM MARBRAND, heir to Ashemark, commander of Lord Tywin’s outriders and scouts,</p>

          <p>— POLLIVER, CHISWYCK, RAFF THE SWEETLING, DUNSEN, and THE TICKLER, soldiers in his service,</p>

          <p>— LEWYS LYDDEN, Lord of the Deep Den,</p>
          <p>— GAWEN WESTERLING, Lord of the Crag, taken captive in the Whispering Wood and held at Seagard,</p>

          <p>— SER FORLEY PRESTER, of the Golden Tooth,</p>
          <p>— VARGO HOAT, of the Free City of Qohor, captain of the sellsword company called the Brave Companions,</p>
          <p>— MAESTER CREYLEN, his counselor.</p>
        </section>
        <section>
          <title>
            <p>HOUSE MARTELL</p>
          </title>
          <empty-line/>
          <image l:href="#i_014.png"/>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>DORNE was the last of the Seven Kingdoms to swear fealty to the Iron Throne. Blood, custom, and history all set the Dornishmen apart from the other kingdoms. When the war of succession broke out, the Prince of Dorne kept his silence and took no part. The Martell banner is a red sun pierced by a golden spear. Their words are <emphasis>Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken.</emphasis></p>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>DORAN NYMEROS MARTELL, Lord of Sunspear, Prince of Dorne,</p>
          <p>— his wife, MELLARIO, of the Free City of Norvos,</p>
          <p>— their children:</p>
          <p>— PRINCESS ARIANNE, their eldest daughter, heir to Sunspear,</p>
          <p>— PRINCE QUENTYN, their eldest son,</p>
          <p>— PRINCE TRYSTANE, their younger son,</p>
          <p>— his siblings:</p>
          <p>— his sister, {PRINCESS ELIA}, wed to Prince Rhaegar Targaryen, slain during the Sack of King’s Landing,</p>
          <p>— Elia’s daughter, {PRINCESS RHAENYS}, a young girl murdered during the Sack of King’s Landing,</p>
          <p>— Elia’s son, {PRINCE AEGON}, a babe, murdered during the Sack of King’s Landing,</p>
          <p>— his brother, PRINCE OBERYN, the Red Viper,</p>
          <p>— his household:</p>
          <p>— AREO HOTAH, a Norvoshi sellsword, captain of guards,</p>
          <p>— MAESTER CALEOTTE, counselor, healer, and tutor,</p>
          <p>— his lords bannermen:</p>
          <p>— EDRIC DAYNE, Lord of Starfall.</p>
          <p>The principal houses sworn to Sunspear include Jordayne, Santagar, Allyrion, Toland, Yronwood, Wyl, Fowler, and Dayne.</p>
        </section>
        <section>
          <title>
            <p>HOUSE TYRELL</p>
          </title>
          <empty-line/>
          <image l:href="#i_015.png"/>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>Lord Tyrell of Highgarden declared his support for King Renly after Renly’s marriage to his daughter Margaery, and brought most of his principal bannermen to Renly’s cause. The Tyrell sigil is a golden rose on a grass-green field. Their words are <emphasis>Growing Strong.</emphasis></p>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>MACE TYRELL, Lord of Highgarden, Warden of the South, Defender of the Marches, High Marshal of the Reach, and Hand of the King,</p>
          <p>— his wife, LADY ALERIE, of House Hightower of Oldtown,</p>
          <p>— their children:</p>
          <p>— WILLAS, their eldest son, heir to Highgarden,</p>
          <p>— SER GARLAN, called the GALLANT, their second son,</p>
          <p>— SER LORAS, the Knight of Flowers, their youngest son, Lord Commander of the Rainbow Guard,</p>
          <p>— MARGAERY, their daughter, a maid of fifteen years, recently wed to Renly Baratheon,</p>
          <p>— his widowed mother, LADY OLENNA of House Redwyne, called the QUEEN OF THORNS,</p>
          <p>— his sisters:</p>
          <p>— MINA, wed to Paxter Redwyne, Lord of the Arbor,</p>
          <p>— their children:</p>
          <p>— SER HORAS REDWYNE, twin to Hobber, mocked as HORROR,</p>
          <p>— SER HOBBER REDWYNE, twin to Horas, mocked as SLOBBER,</p>
          <p>— DESMERA REDWYNE, a maid of sixteen,</p>
          <p>— JANNA, wed to Ser Jon Fossoway,</p>
          <p>— his uncles:</p>
          <p>— GARTH, called the GROSS, Lord Seneschal of Highgarden,</p>
          <p>— Garth’s bastard sons, GARSE and GARRETT FLOWERS,</p>
          <p>— SER MORYN, Lord Commander of the City Watch of Oldtown,</p>
          <p>— MAESTER GORMON, a scholar of the Citadel,</p>
          <p>— his household:</p>
          <p>— MAESTER LOMYS, counselor, healer, and tutor,</p>
          <p>— IGON VYRWEL, captain of the guard,</p>
          <p>— SER VORTIMER CRANE, master-at-arms,</p>
          <p>— BUTTERBUMPS, fool and jester, hugely fat.</p>
        </section>
        <section>
          <title>
            <p>THE MEN OF THE NIGHT’S WATCH</p>
          </title>
          <p>The Night’s Watch protects the realm, and is sworn to take no part in civil wars and contests for the throne. Traditionally, in times of rebellion, they do honor to all kings and obey none.</p>
          <empty-line/>
          <p>At Castle Black</p>
          <p>JEOR MORMONT, Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch, called the OLD BEAR,</p>
          <p>— his steward and squire, JON SNOW, the bastard of Winterfell, called LORD SNOW,</p>
          <p>— Jon’s white direwolf, GHOST,</p>
          <p>— MAESTER AEMON (TARGARYEN), counselor and healer,</p>
          <p>— SAMWELL TARLY and CLYDAS, his stewards,</p>
          <p>— BENJEN STARK, First Ranger, lost beyond the Wall,</p>
          <p>— THOREN SMALLWOOD, a senior ranger,</p>
          <p>— JARMEN BUCKWELL, a senior ranger,</p>
          <p>— SER OTTYN WYTHERS, SER ALADALE WYNCH, GRENN, PYPAR, MATTHAR, ELRON, LARK called the SISTERMAN, rangers,</p>
          <p>— OTHELL YARWYCK, First Builder,</p>
          <p>— HALDER, ALBETT, builders,</p>
          <p>— BOWEN MARSH, Lord Steward</p>
          <p>— CHETT, steward and dog handler,</p>
          <p>— EDDISON TOLLETT, called DOLOROUS EDD, a dour squire,</p>
          <p>— SEPTON CELLADAR, a drunken devout,</p>
          <p>— SER ENDREW TARTH, master-at-arms,</p>
          <p>— brothers of Castle Black:</p>
          <p>— DONAL NOYE, armorer and smith, one-armed,</p>
          <p>— THREE-FINGER HOBB, cook,</p>
          <p>— JEREN, RAST, CUGEN, recruits still in training,</p>
          <p>— CONWY, GUEREN, “wandering crows,” recruiters who collect orphan boys and criminals for the Wall,</p>
          <p>— YOREN, the senior of the “wandering crows,”</p>
          <p>— PRAED, CUTJACK, WOTH, REYSEN, QYLE, recruits bound for the Wall,</p>
          <p>— KOSS, GERREN, DOBBER, KURZ, BITER, RORGE, JAQEN H’GHAR, criminals bound for the Wall,</p>
          <p>— LOMMY GREENHANDS, GENDRY, TARBER, HOT PIE, ARRY, orphan boys bound for the Wall.</p>
          <p>At Eastwatch-by-the-Sea</p>
          <p>COTTER PYKE, Commander, Eastwatch,</p>
          <p>— SER ALLISER THORNE, master-at-arms,</p>
          <p>— brothers of Eastwatch:</p>
          <p>— DAREON, steward and singer.</p>
          <p>At the Shadow Tower</p>
          <p>SER DENYS MALLISTER, Commander, Shadow Tower,</p>
          <p>— QHORIN called HALFHAND, a senior ranger,</p>
          <p>— DALBRIDGE, an elderly squire and senior ranger,</p>
          <p>— EBBEN, STONESNAKE, rangers.</p>
        </section>
      </section>
    </section>
